archetype_name: Family Skillet Curries & Stir-Fries (Medium Heat, 15–30, Intermediate)
name: Quick Massaman Beef & Potato Curry with Jasmine Rice
description: Family-friendly Thai-style massaman curry with tender beef and potatoes in coconut sauce, finished with lime and crunchy peanuts. Medium heat, ready in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Rinse 1.5 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear.
Dice potatoes into 1 cm cubes (about 500 g).
Slice beef thinly against the grain (about 500 g).
Microwave the diced potatoes in a covered, microwave-safe bowl for 4–5 minutes until just tender; drain.
Open coconut milk can and measure massaman curry paste (about 3 tbsp).
cook_steps: Cook rice on the stovetop per pack directions (about 1.5 cups rice to 3 cups water); keep warm.
Heat a large skillet or wok over medium heat and dry-toast the chopped peanuts for 2–3 minutes until fragrant; set aside.
Add canola oil to the skillet (1–2 tbsp). Add sliced onions and cook 2–3 minutes until starting to soften.
Stir in massaman curry paste (about 3 tbsp) and cook 30–60 seconds to bloom.
Increase heat to medium-high. Add sliced beef and stir-fry 2–3 minutes until just losing pink.
Pour in coconut milk (400 ml). Add fish sauce (1–2 tbsp), brown sugar (1–2 tsp to taste), and chili flakes (1/2 tsp). Stir to combine.
Add the par-cooked potatoes. Simmer 5–7 minutes, stirring, until potatoes are tender and sauce slightly thickens. Adjust seasoning with a splash more fish sauce or a pinch of brown sugar if needed.
Squeeze lime over the curry to taste.
Serve curry over jasmine rice and top with toasted peanuts.
